Package objects

Class PoolBall

  • java.lang.Object
    • objects.PoolBall
  • public class PoolBall
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract class for a pool ball. Subclass this, calling the super constructor and filling in the appropriate values (colour and point value)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  PoolBall.Type
      Enum for every different type of Snooker ball

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      PoolBall​(PoolBall.Type type, double x, double z)
      Default and only constructor for a pool ball

      Returns the number of points this ball is worth

    • Constructor Detail

      • PoolBall

        public PoolBall​(PoolBall.Type type,
                double x,
                double z)
        Default and only constructor for a pool ball
        Parameters:
        type - The type of Snooker pool ball. Use the enum PoolBall.Type
        x - x-right position of this ball to spawn and rest at
        z - z-forward position of this ball to spawn and rest at

      • getHeight

        public static double getHeight()
        Static method that returns the y-up height that all pool balls spawn, move, and rest at.
        Returns:
        Height position on the y-up axis

      • getPos

        public org.jogamp.vecmath.Vector3d getPos()
        Gets the worldspace position of this ball
        Returns:
        The position of this ball as a Vector3d

      • getPos

        public void getPos​(org.jogamp.vecmath.Vector3d posRef)
        Sets the value of the given Vector3d reference to this ball's position
        Parameters:
        posRef - Reference to a Vector3d to edit

      • setPos

        public void setPos​(org.jogamp.vecmath.Vector3d pos)
        Sets the position of this ball and updates the TransformGroup of this ball.
        Parameters:
        pos - The new position to set to. The y value is ignored and replace with the static height.

      • setPos

        public void setPos​(double x,
                   double z)
        Sets the position of this ball and updates the TransformGroup of this ball.
        Parameters:
        x - The new x-right position to set to
        z - The new z-forward position to set to
